Key Match Events: The Oklahoma City Thunder extended their winning streak to 14 games with a 117-107 victory over the New York Knicks.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander led the Thunder in scoring with 33 points and added seven assists.
Aaron Wiggins knocked down five 3-pointers in the fourth quarter and finished the contest with 19 points.
Oklahoma City ended the Knicks' winning streak at nine contests.
The Thunder overcame a 14-point deficit to secure the victory.
Mikal Bridges scored 24 points for the Knicks, while Karl-Anthony Towns added 17 points and 22 rebounds.
Oklahoma City center Isaiah Hartenstein faced off against his former team for the first time since leaving in free agency and recorded four points, 14 rebounds, and seven assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder led the Knicks 44-5 in points off the bench.
The NBA does not count the Thunder's defeat in the NBA Cup final to the Milwaukee Bucks in December as an official loss.
